Summary: Versatile, high-level language with dynamic semantics for general-purpose programming; popular in data science.
Weaknesses: Slower execution, Limited threading due to GIL.

Summary: Language and environment for statistical computing and graphics; widely used by statisticians and data miners.
Strengths: Comprehensive statistical tools, Superior data visualization
Weaknesses: Less memory efficient, Steeper learning curve.

Summary: Multi-paradigm system language focused on safety and performance; not traditionally for data science.
Strengths: Memory safety without GC, Concurrency without data races
Weaknesses: Steeper learning curve, Smaller data science ecosystem.

Summary: High-level, statically typed language integrating object-oriented and functional features; used in big data.
Strengths: JVM compatibility, Good for big data applications

Summary: High-level, high-performance dynamic language for technical computing with familiar syntax.
Strengths: High-performance for numerical computing, Easy to write and read code
